title: A key opening a way to every common understanding, how to discern the difference betwixt the religion professed by the people called Quakers and the perversions, misrepresentations and calumnies of their several adversaries : published in great good will to all, but more especially for their sakes that are actually under prejudice from vulgar abuses.
author: Penn, William, 1644-1718.
publisher: Printed for Thomas Northcott, in George-yard in Lombard-street.,
notes: Item at reel 1408:1 incorrectly identified as Wing P1313.
Reproductions of original in the Harvard University Library.
